entry.title: AI Features in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2023 FSP03
entry.content:
In this blog post, let's delve into the innovations delivered with Feature Pack Stack 03 for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, which was released in March 2025. We will focus on the cutting-edge innovations powered by artificial intelligence, revolutionizing how businesses operate and thrive. For an in-depth overview of the release, check out the latest update from our expert @Harish_Mangtani and his blog on this Cloud ERP solution.

The recent release of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition introduces over 300 innovations, further enhancing capabilities across diverse business lines and industries. Key highlights include:

  • 200+ Innovations for Lines of Business
  • 60+ Innovations for Industry-Specific Needs
  • Numerous Localization and Cross-Topic Improvements

 

Join us as we explore how these innovations, especially in artificial intelligence, are setting new benchmarks in digital transformation, enabling businesses to harness data-driven insights for optimized decision-making and strategic growth.

Don’t miss this quick video that highlights some key innovations showcased in this post.

Please note that the following video was produced with Synthesia, a new platform that allows users to create videos featuring a digital twin of yourself and even includes a personal AI-generated Voice for an authentic touch.

  • Faster access to updates – Videos are created more frequently, so you're always getting the latest and most accurate information
  • Engaging and accessible – Short, to-the-point videos
  • More inclusive – Videos include subtitles and can be consumed in multiple languages

 

Watch now and let us know what you think in the comments!

Product Highlights

As enterprises look towards the future, the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2023 FPS03 leads the charge with seven groundbreaking AI innovations. These advancements are designed to streamline operations, enhance financial accuracy, and optimize resource management, setting the stage for effective and sustainable business transformation.

1. AI-Assisted Journal Uploads

Finance departments can now leverage generative AI for journal uploads, automating the creation and validation processes. By assigning guidance documents and automatically generating posting proposals, businesses ensure accuracy and compliance. This allows financial professionals to pivot their focus towards strategic financial planning, supported by a reliable audit trail. 

 

 

 

2. AI-Assisted In-House Service Initiation
Repair processing becomes seamless with AI extracting vital data from scanned documents. The system reads these documents, proposes necessary repairs, and reduces manual efforts significantly. Automated identification of equipment further enhances efficiency, offering a higher degree of accuracy and reducing the likelihood of errors in repair processing.

 


3. Joule-Enabled Mass Modification of Sales Orders

Sales Order Management sees significant enhancement using Joule's Copilot capabilities. Performing mass changes to sales orders is now faster and more efficient, as users can update multiple orders simultaneously by applying a simple command. This innovation minimizes the need for manual updates and enhances overall efficiency in sales order management.

 


4. AI-Based Explanation Assistant for Detailed Scheduling

For production planning, the AI-based Explanation Assistant offers clear insights into scheduling results. It provides real-time feedback and detailed summaries, enabling production planners to understand and trust the outcomes of the Detailed Scheduling Optimizer. This enhances transparency and ensures smooth operations, driving efficiency in production environments.

 

5. Project System Support with Joule Copilot Capabilities

Project management is revolutionized with Joule's new project assistant capabilities. Project system users can now access instant data and status updates using everyday language queries, eliminating the need for complex navigation in multiple systems. This innovation streamlines data consolidation, providing a comprehensive overview of a project’s progress with ease.

 

6. Joule-Enhanced Search for Bills of Materials

Selective Joule scenarios enhance exploration capabilities within Bills of Materials. Users can utilize simple, natural language queries to search product data efficiently. This is particularly beneficial for R&D engineers and change coordinators, enabling cost-effective product lifecycle management and increased flexibility in change-record operations.

 

7. Intelligent Vehicle Assignment in Automotive Management

In automotive vehicle management, intelligent assignment capabilities ensure optimal matching between vehicle configurations and sales orders. The intuitive app streamlines inventory management by optimizing vehicle assignments and facilitates swaps or unassignments efficiently, improving the overall processing speed.

 

For more details on the innovations mentioned, watch the video and use the chapter markers to skip directly to the topics you're most interested in.

Summary and what to do next

As you can see, we have a lot to offer, very much based on feedback of clients running their business on SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition.

Thanks for your interest in this product update for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition. Follow the PSCC_Enablement tag to stay up to date with our latest blog posts across the Cloud ERP portfolio.

SAP S/4HANA  

 Find All of Our Assets 

SAP S/4HANA Cloud is the foundation of the intelligent, sustainable enterprise and is an innovative, robust, and scalable ERP. We at Cloud ERP Product Success and Cloud Co-Innovation offer a service as versatile as our product itself. Check out the numerous offerings our team has created for you below:

entry.title: Collaborate on the Next Evolution of SAP BTP: Join the SAP Customer Engagement Initiative 2025-2
entry.content:
SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP) is transforming how enterprises innovate. As a unified platform that brings together application development, automation, data and analytics, integration, and AI, SAP BTP enables businesses to unlock new levels of efficiency and intelligence - all while maximizing the value of their SAP investments.

Now, imagine being part of that transformation.

The second cycle of the SAP Customer Engagement Initiative for 2025 has just launched and it’s your chance to influence the future of SAP BTP. As a customer or partner, you’re invited to directly engage with SAP developers and product teams to help shape upcoming features, tools, and innovations.

This is more than just early insights - it’s a chance to influence the future of enterprise technology.

But don’t wait - registration is open only until July 25, 2025.

You can sign up to collaborate on one or more of the following active projects:

  • Apply your brand to SAP applications using the UI theme designer
  • Automation and AI in SAP Discovery Center
  • Building BTP Solutions effectively with AI-augmented Infrastructure as Code Generation
  • Enhancing the User Experience of SAP Continuous Integration and Delivery
  • Flexible Cost Allocations using SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud Universal Model
  • IT Financial Management Cost Allocation Module in SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud
  • Logging Feedback Day - SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry Runtime
  • Making your business future ready for Agentic AI - reimagining application development on BTP
  • Operational Transfer Pricing Optimization in SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud
  • SAP Build - Discovery Initiative
  • Strategic Planning Scenarios in SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud Universal Model
  • The Future of Autonomous Software Engineering (ASE) in the Enterprise Context
  • Using a Custom Theme Across SAP Platforms and Systems

Let’s shape the future together!

Innovation happens through collaboration. By participating in the SAP Customer Engagement Initiative projects, you help SAP create better, more relevant solutions for businesses like yours. This is your chance to influence what comes next.

Don’t miss out – sign up today at influence.sap.com and be a part of the SAP Customer Engagement Initiative Cycle 2 in 2025!

Warm regards, 
Your SAP Customer Engagement Initiative Team 

Follow-up after registration: When you register for a project, you will be invited to an introductory call with the SAP project lead. At this point further participation is optional. Typically, all activities are governed by the Feedback Agreement with SAP.

entry.title: Why Is My Purchase Order (PO) Delayed? Using OpenAI to Make SAP Actually Talk
entry.content:
Why Is My PO Delayed? Using OpenAI to Make SAP Actually Talk

Let me guess—you’re in SAP ME23N, trying to understand why that PO is still open. You’ve clicked through MD04, peeked at the long text, scanned the vendor confirmation, maybe even shot off a panicked email.

And still… no clarity.

Here’s the thing: SAP gives you data. AI gives you the explanation.

The Question That Sparked This Post

One of our clients asked me:

“Can’t SAP just tell me why the PO is delayed—in normal language?”

And that stopped me. Because… why not?

If we can ask ChatGPT to explain black holes, why can’t SAP just tell us why PO450001 is delayed?
And actually sound like a human?

Turns out—it can.

From Clues to Clarity: How OpenAI Helps SAP Make Sense

Every delayed PO leaves behind a breadcrumb trail:

  • MD04 long text says “QC not cleared”

  • MSEG has no GR date

  • Vendor note hints at shipment damage

  • MD06 shows exception 30

Now, if you’re fluent in SAPese, great. But for everyone else? AI can translate this noise into clarity.

Imagine this flow:

  1. User types: “Why is PO450001 delayed?”

  2. ABAP gathers delivery schedules, MRP messages, vendor texts, MD04 notes.

  3. Middleware (Python or Node.js) sends it to OpenAI.

  4. GPT reads the context and responds:

    “Vendor has not dispatched the goods. QC clearance is pending. MD04 indicates no upcoming GR. Recommend follow-up with QA and vendor.”

No digging. No hunting across 5 transactions. Just clarity.

What This Actually Looks Like (No Code, Just Logic)

Here’s the high-level blueprint:

SAP → Middleware → OpenAI → Human Explanation

  • ABAP or Fiori app assembles the facts.

  • Middleware sends the structured prompt to OpenAI.

  • GPT responds in plain English, summarizing reasoning.

  • You display this in a chatbot panel, SAP Card, or email.

Suddenly, SAP starts feeling like a teammate, not a maze.

Okay, But Why Not Just Use a Custom Report?

You can. And in many cases, you should.

But here’s what we’ve seen across different roles:

Role Typical Feedback

Sales“I see the PO, but why is it late?”
Procurement Head“I don’t want to read every MRP line.”
New Planner“I have no idea what these exceptions mean.”

OpenAI bridges the gap between technical depth and functional understanding.
It’s not just report output—it’s meaningful delivery.

 How This Plays With SAP Joule & SAP AI

You might be thinking:

“Wait—doesn’t SAP have Joule for this now?”

Yes—and it’s powerful. Here’s how to choose your path:

🟦 Prefer Native? SAP Joule Might Be Your Best Bet

If you're on S/4HANA Cloud or SuccessFactors, SAP Joule is a built-in assistant that understands SAP metadata, honors user roles, and works out-of-the-box—no middleware required. It’s your AI assistant with enterprise-grade security baked in.

🧠 Building Your Own SAP-Savvy LLM?

If you're training your own model on SAP notes, planner comments, and connected systems (PLM, MES, JIRA, etc.), this blog could be of use. Replace the OpenAI call with your internal LLM endpoint—the SAP-to-AI flow stays the same.

Whether you want agility or control, this approach scales both ways.

Want to Try This Yourself?

Here’s a simple Proof of Concept to play with:

  • Create a Fiori tile: “Explain PO Delay”

  • ABAP collects long texts, MD04 exceptions, vendor comments

  • Middleware sends a prompt like:

    “PO450001 is not GR’d. MD04 shows QC hold. Vendor note says raw material shortage.”

  • GPT responds:

    “PO is delayed due to raw material shortage at vendor and pending QC clearance. MD04 confirms no GR expected. Suggest escalation to QA team.”

✅It reads your SAP data like a planner
✅Replies like a colleague

 

Next Blog Sneak Peek 👀

Coming up next:

🔧How to auto-generate visual work instructions from SAP PM orders using OpenAI’s image generation API (DALL·E).
From boring IW33 text to illustrated SOPs. For real.

Looking for feedback, especially if you want to give detailed steps with SAP AI, and your own experience of linking custom LLMs

entry.title: SAP Fiori development newsletter July 2025 (issue #35)
entry.content:
Summer is here, bringing hot weather across the U.S. and around the world. SAP is also turning up the temperature with hot new AI-powered innovations, many of which were introduced at Sapphire (see article below). Even more new stuff is planned for TechEd and Devtoberfest in the fall.

For ongoing updates, I encourage you to join our monthly SAP Fiori development roundtable. You can meet online with fellow developers and the SAP engineers who build our professional development tools. Register online or email me for an invitation. Our next meeting is Wednesday, July 9, 2025. 

If you prefer to receive this in your inbox, please subscribe to the SAP Fiori development newsletter.

Development News

Sapphire had great innovations, if you are on public cloud

There were lots of announcements about new innovations for both developers and business users. The question for many customers is when their systems will be current enough to consume them. Read about the two parallel universes – one filled with AI in the cloud and the other grounded in legacy code.
https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/parallel-universes-the-dual-nature-of-ux-and-ai-among-sap-customers-at/ba-p/14113975

SAP Fiori tools 2506 now available

The 2506 release of SAP Fiori tools includes enhancements that make full-stack development with SAP Fiori elements and RAP even more seamless—from initial app creation to UI adaptation and low-code configuration.
https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-fiori-tools-2506-update-open-source-faster-app-creation-adaptation/ba-p/14131156

AI-powered project accelerator

The AI-powered project accelerator from SAP Fiori tools automates multiple steps, including creating a data model, preparing mock data, building an OData service, generating an SAP Fiori app and adding the necessary annotations. See how to set up a trial account and try it for yourself.
https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/from-idea-to-app-using-ai-powered-project-accelerator-to-develop-sap-fiori/ba-p/14095300

Introducing SAPUI5 version preview in SAP Build Work Zone

We have introduced a new option to preview an upcoming SAPUI5 version for SAP Build Work Zone. This capability aims to provide a controlled environment for evaluating SAPUI5 updates in SAP Build Work Zone, thereby avoiding immediate changes in production environments.
https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/introducing-sapui5-version-preview-in-sap-build-work-zone/ba-p/14117996

Explore SAPUI5 1.136.x-legacy-free for future-proof UI5 apps

SAPUI5 1.136.x-legacy-free deprecated code removed is now available via cloud access. Test your code for future-proof best practices and provide early feedback to the UI5 team.
https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/explore-sapui5-openui5-1-136-x-legacy-free/ba-p/14103271

SAPUI5 is leading the way in accessibility with WCAG 2.2

Accessibility is key to using SAP's business solutions. Adopting the latest standards ensures that solutions are inclusive and meet the diverse needs of users globally. When creating apps with SAP Build and SAPUI5, developers can leverage the latest Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG).
https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/sapui5-is-leading-the-way-in-accessibility-with-wcag-2-2/ba-p/14101596

SAP Fiori Application Generator available in open source

The SAP Fiori tools team is delighted to announce that the underlying code for the SAP Fiori Application Generator has been moved entirely to open source. This has been a long journey...
https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-fiori-application-generator-available-in-open-source/ba-p/14109021

New SAP Design System portal for SAP Fiori design guidelines

The SAP Design System portal contains everything about the design system, including comprehensive new UI Kits for designers in Figma.
https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/new-sap-design-system-portal-for-sap-fiori-design-guidelines-and-new-ui/ba-p/14109558

Quickly generate and deploy SAP Fiori apps from ABAP Development Tools for Eclipse

The new quick SAP Fiori application generator lets you generate an application based on SAP Fiori elements annotations and deploy the SAP Fiori UI with only a few clicks from the service binding editor in ADT.
https://community.sap.com/t5/application-development-and-automation-blog-posts/quickly-generate-and-deploy-sap-fiori-apps-from-abap-development-tools-for/ba-p/14116822

Events

SAP Fiori Innovation Day Bangalore 

The biggest SAP Fiori Innovation Day ever!
This summary highlights the key sessions, insights from our presentations, and the remarkable contributions from our local development community.
https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-fiori-innovation-day-bangalore-connection-gratitude-ai-and-local/ba-p/14129580

SAP Fiori Innovation Day Dallas

  •              October 17 as part of the ASUG chapter meeting
  •              Registration link opening soon - mark your calendar now

SAP Fiori Innovation Day Paris

  •              December 10
  •              Registration link opening soon - mark your calendar now

All our SAP Fiori Innovation Day events are open to customers.
If you are a partner, please let me know if you are interested in sponsoring in one or both of our locations.
I hope you can join us.

SAP TechEd

Registration is now open for both the in-person event in Berlin and the virtual event. Here are details on what you can expect.
https://community.sap.com/t5/sap-teched-blog-posts/sap-teched-2025-registration-is-live-check-out-our-brand-new-hybrid/ba-p/14107573

entry.title: yaai & yaai_ui – Open-Source AI Tools for ABAP Developers
entry.content:
Open-Source AI Tools for ABAP Developers

A few months ago, I embarked on a journey to learn about and explore large language models. After spending some time coding in Python and experimenting with Ollama, LangChain, LangGraph, and many other tools in the Python ecosystem, I decided to challenge myself to do similar things in ABAP, the programming language I've been working with for nearly two decades.

Well, I'm still on this journey, and to be honest, as crazy as it might sound, I'm having a lot of fun 🤓. I've lost count of how many times I've found myself laughing, hardly believing what I was seeing while testing features like function calling and retrieval-augmented generation. Honestly, developing AI-powered applications in ABAP is something that never crossed my mind. For someone who started with ABAP version 4.6C, it's quite mind-blowing.

I think the tools I've been developing over the last few months might be of interest to other ABAP developers who want to dive into the rabbit hole of large language models and all the things they are capable of. The possibilities are endless.

So, it's time to share this with the ABAP community. I hope to see many of you having fun using AI right within ABAP, bringing new ideas, and hopefully contributing to these projects. 😊
 
Introducing yaai & yaai_ui
 
I'm happy to share yaai - ABAP AI tools and its companion project, yaai_ui - ABAP AI User Interface with the ABAP community! These two open-source repositories are designed to equip ABAP developers to easily integrate Artificial Intelligence, specifically Large Language Models (LLMs), directly into their SAP systems using only ABAP code.

The goal of yaai and yaai_ui is to enable ABAP developers to learn and explore Artificial Intelligence capabilities within their familiar environment—at no cost. The only potential cost is for paid AI APIs (such as OpenAI), if you choose to use them. You can get started right away using free APIs like Google Gemini, or by running your own self-hosted LLMs with Ollama.
 
Introducing yaai - ABAP AI tools: Your Backend AI Engine for ABAP
 
The https://github.com/christianjianelli/yaai repository provides a set of tools focused on backend AI integration for ABAP environments. It's built to facilitate powerful AI capabilities that you can leverage directly within your SAP applications.

Key Features of ABAP AI tools include:
  • Multi-Provider LLM API Support: This is a core strength, offering flexibility in choosing your LLM provider and deployment model. Currently supported APIs include OpenAI (cloud-based), Ollama (local/self-hosted), and Google Gemini (cloud-based). The tools are also compatible with APIs from other providers, such as Nvidia, that implement OpenAI API standards, possibly with minor adjustments.

  • Conversation Management: The tools allow you to maintain and manage multi-turn conversations, providing full access to conversation history for advanced chat scenarios directly within your ABAP applications.

  • Tool/Function Calling: Integrate your existing ABAP business logic with LLMs using function/tool calling. This enables AI models to directly trigger ABAP methods, opening up new possibilities for intelligent automation and process enhancement.

  • Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG): Enhance the accuracy and relevance of LLM outputs by incorporating your enterprise data. This allows you to build applications that provide more context-aware and specific answers by pulling information from your SAP system.
These features collectively can help you to learn how to build intelligent ABAP applications that leverage the latest advancements in AI.
 
Meet yaai_ui - ABAP AI User Interface: Bringing AI to the User's Fingertips
 
Complementing the backend tools, the https://github.com/christianjianelli/yaai_ui repository provides ready-to-use user interface components to interact with LLMs directly from your SAP system. This project simplifies the creation of engaging AI-powered frontends in ABAP.

The ABAP AI User Interface includes:
  • Chat Interface: Enable conversational AI interactions directly within your SAP system, allowing users to engage with LLMs in a familiar chat window.

  • Code Assistant: Access AI-powered code suggestions and assistance for ABAP development, potentially boosting developer productivity and code quality.
 


 

 

Getting Started is Simple!
 
Both repositories can be easily installed into your SAP system using abapGit.

Prerequisites for installation include:
  • An SAP system running ABAP version 7.52 or higher
  • abapGit installed and configured in your ABAP system
  • Appropriate developer authorizations in your ABAP system
Important Note: To use the ABAP AI User Interface, the ABAP AI Tools (yaai) must be installed first in your SAP system. Detailed installation steps are provided in each repository's documentation.
You can find quickstart guides in the documentation to help you run your first simple LLM application or chat application.
 
Explore, Experiment, and Contribute!

These tools are currently experimental and released under the MIT License. This means they are provided "as is" and you use them at your own risk. However, this also means they are open for community collaboration!

I encourage you to:
  • Explore the repositories on GitHub:
    • yaai - ABAP AI tools: https://github.com/christianjianelli/yaai
    • yaai_ui - ABAP AI User Interface: https://github.com/christianjianelli/yaai_ui

  • Experiment with the examples and integrate them into your own ABAP projects.
  • Provide feedback and contribute to the evolving project.
Start building your intelligent ABAP applications today! 😊

This text was written with the help of Artificial Intelligence.

entry.title: SAP AI Certified & My First GenAI Prototype: MRP Exception Analyzer
entry.content:
After completing both the SAP AI Foundation certification (C_AIG_2412) and a non-SAP generative AI course, I was eager to bring my learning into action, not just in theory, but by building something tangible.

So, I created my first GenAI-powered prototype: an MRP Exception Analyzer.

What I Built

This prototype is a lightweight app where you input any SAP MRP exception message code, and it generates a natural-language explanation, just like how a planner would search SAP Help or SAP Community for answers. Instead of just technical terms, the tool provides a clear and actionable explanation to help users understand the issue and what can be done, making it useful for both experienced SAP planners and those new to MRP.

Try it here:
https://sap-genai-mrp-assistant-drold6eyz49jew7ramuuqr.streamlit.app/

Skills Applied in the POC

To build this prototype, I used:

  • Prompt engineering, Python scripting, Streamlit for quick UI, CSV-based response caching , OpenAI API integration

From POC to Production: Why Build This in SAP?

While this prototype works well for learning and early feedback, moving such solutions into the SAP ecosystem using SAP AI Core and Generative AI Hub has significant advantages.

Key Benefits of Using SAP BTP for GenAI

  • Trusted Model Access: SAP's Generative AI Hub enables access to large language models that are grounded in business and context data.

  • Model Flexibility: The hub supports multiple foundation models, allowing you to select the best fit for your business use case.

  • End-to-End AI Lifecycle: SAP supports the development, deployment, and management of custom AI solutions within a secure enterprise framework.

  • Code Reusability: Existing Python logic from prototypes like this can be ported into SAP AI Core pipelines without major rework, making it easier to scale up.

What's Next

This version uses general SAP Help–style responses. In the next iteration, I plan to incorporate domain-specific knowledge for more intelligent, context-aware recommendations tailored to specific industries or company practices.

I’d love to hear your thoughts, feedback, or suggestions — especially if you're working with MRP, AI, or SAP BTP. Let’s explore how we can bring more GenAI solutions into SAP together.

entry.title: AI Agents - Thinking Fast & Thinking Slow, Balancing Autonomy and Determinism in Joule agents
entry.content:
As artificial intelligence becomes ever more central to the modern business landscape, striking the right balance between autonomy and determinism is emerging as a critical challenge. This article sets the stage for a thoughtful exploration of agentic AI—intelligent systems that navigate between routine efficiency and flexible reasoning. Rather than applying deep reasoning to every problem, we’ll discuss why reserving advanced autonomy for truly complex challenges ensures reliability, predictability, and innovation in automation. To demonstrate our strategic approach to leveraging intelligent automation, I will outline how Joule and its agents are calibrated to apply the optimal level of intelligence to each business challenge, along with the guiding principles for deploying agentic AI effectively in enterprise environments.

The key to agentic AI is knowing when not to apply it

One theory that has profoundly impacted my perspective on thinking and decision making and influenced my decision to focus my PhD on how managers frame decisions, is research on the cognitive practices and biases in decision making. The book summarizing many of the principles is Thinking, Fast and Slow, by noble prize winner Daniel Kahneman. This global bestseller delves into the intriguing mechanics of the human mind, articulating the ways we deploy two distinct types of cognitive processes: the swift, instinctual fast thinking, also referred to as thinking, and the deliberate, analytical slow thinking, also referred to as System 2 thinking. These systems influence our judgments, often leading to both noteworthy strengths and predictable errors in our decision making, yet they remain essential for effective and deliberate cognitive processes.

Amid the whirlwind excitement surrounding Artificial Intelligence (AI) and specifically AI agents, this theory provides a crucial frame of reference. As mentioned in my earlier article, we define agents following the  , stating that agents apply reasoning, reflection, tool usage and multi-agent access towards a predefined goal to achieve non-deterministic outcomes. Thus, AI agents qualify as System 2 thinkers by definition. They are always thinking slowly, in terms of reasoning over a problem, even though the level of reasoning can be optimized based on the complexity of the problems with test-time compute models.

However, in the realm of agentic AI, there's a growing tendency to apply the more deliberate but slower System 2-like reasoning to every problem, leading to inefficiencies. Just as humans don't overthink simple tasks like opening a cereal box or hammering a nail, AI doesn't need complex reasoning and frontier AI models for straightforward tasks. By pushing AI to operate in a System 2 mode unnecessarily, we sacrifice speed, reliability, and cost-efficiency. Instead, many tasks would benefit from a System 1 approach. This approach means using faster, simpler models that quickly match user queries to known skills and carry them out based on how closely the query fits those skills.

In essence, the key to unlocking greater efficiency and reliability in agentic AI lies –ironically– lies in recognizing when not to apply full agentic AI, but rather System 1 thinking, leveraging minimal intelligence for identifying which tasks to select and match parameters, and reserving System 2 reasoning for truly complex challenges. This approach of course also requires a certain level of intelligence and thus AI to be employed but the intelligence would be limited to identifying the problem and recognizing a readymade solution, which may involve simplified reasoning approaches but could also rely on simpler approaches like comparing embeddings of queries and skills.

What Does This Mean for Agentic AI in Business?

In the business world, the distinction between System 1 and System 2 thinking is crucial for deploying agentic AI efficiently. At SAP, we’ve embraced this concept with Joule, our intelligent copilot. Joule is designed to apply the appropriate level of intelligence to each task, ensuring maximum efficiency and reliability. Joule consists of three main components: Joule as our new UI in the age of AI, Joule agents also including Joule skills, which is containing the business logic and executing business process using AI as well as AI Foundations, which increasingly is turning into our operating system for AI with all underlying platform services. For applying our theory, we specifically focus on Joule agents and skills and here we need to differentiate between two main mechanisms: reason and act. Reason subsumes all activities Joule employs to create multi-step plans and reflect, whereas Act summarizes all tool activity, including tools like calling APIs, involving the human user or calling tools or other agents via protocols (MCP/A2A). Joule’s approach to reason is structured in three stages that are a testament to our obsession for reliable, relevant and responsible task execution:



  • Joule Skills (System 1 thinking): When you give Joule a straightforward task, like creating a purchase order or updating an HR record, it recognizes this as a Joule Skill. These are routine, deterministic tasks that don't require complex reasoning models, just the identification of the right tool or process. This aligns with System 1 thinking – fast, efficient, and reliable.

  • Joule Native Agenticness (lean System 2 thinking): For tasks that involve a sequence of steps – like creating a purchase order and confirming the creation to the supplier – Joule combines multiple skills into workflows. This stage still already relies on a lean version of System 2 thinking but handles more complex, yet deterministic and repetitive sequences within a consistent business logic. It requires reasoning, but only to identify a set of deterministic tools, which makes the result much more predictable and repeatable. It ensures an effective execution of a series of tasks in the correct order without needing the heavy cognitive load of full System 2 . SAP Knowledge Graph plays a pivotal role in ensuring the reliability of such scenarios.

  • Joule Agents (full System 2 thinking): For complex, non-deterministic tasks that require genuine reasoning and autonomy – for instance evaluating analytical data or executing automations across departments – Joule leverages full agentic AI. This is where System 2 thinking comes in, using advanced reasoning models, a deeper grounding in the business specific business context and specialized tools to navigate the complexity of the task. Also, here SAP Knowledge Graph will allow us another level of grounding into entities involved (business data), execution logic (business configuration & logic) and execution flow (business process).

By adopting this tiered approach, SAP ensures that Joule not only enhances efficiency and reliability but also aligns with real-world business needs. It applies the right level of intelligence to each scenario, from simple, repetitive tasks to complex, strategic decisions, ensuring that businesses can achieve more with less cognitive overhead and more importantly produces more reliable, predictable and consistent business outcomes.

The Strategic Role of Reasoning in Agentic AI

Does this mean that reasoning is not essential? Not at all. While leveraging System 1 thinking for many tasks boosts efficiency, reasoning remains a cornerstone of agentic AI for specific, critical applications.

Two core principles guide our approach to autonomy in business processes:

1) Apply as much autonomy as necessary and as little as possible.

Autonomy should allow to select which deterministic tools to apply, but it should not generate different answers to the same or similar questions at hand. Applying as little autonomy as possible allows our Joule skills and agents to make results more predictable, consistent and reliable.  This principle is crucial, as business operations depend on consistency and deterministic outcomes. Achieving predictable and reliable results fosters organizational trust and operational continuity, particularly when applied to routine business processes.

2) Apply reasoning and autonomy to complex problems & scaling deterministic tool creation.

Autonomy delivers significant value when applied to complex, non-routine, or high-priority tasks. In scenarios that demand a thorough understanding of business context and process intricacies, require precise semantic interpretation, span multiple business roles or domains, or involve unique activities such as advanced data analytics, the application of robust reasoning remains essential. Moreover, effective reasoning is instrumental in fulfilling our foundational principle: it enables the identification of optimal methods for task execution, subsequently informing the development of efficient System 1 tools—such as Joule Skills—that drive operational excellence by ensuring outcomes are consistently deterministic, reliable, and scalable.

Trust Earned with Agentic AI Will Allow for a Paradigm Shift in Business Software

To encapsulate these principles, I’d like to echo the perspective of our Chief Technology Officer and Chief AI Officer, Philipp Herzig, who recently described the transformative paradigm shift underway in business software. We are transitioning from a reactive “insight to action” approach—where users interpret data and trigger actions manually—towards a more advanced “reason and act” model. In this new landscape, software proactively interprets information and proposes meaningful actions for the user.

This shift is not merely technological; it is foundational to how we ensure real-world business success. As we embrace this evolution, it is critical to heed the guidance outlined above: we must apply technology judiciously, striking the right balance between reliable, deterministic workflows for routine scenarios and granting autonomy where complex, nuanced reasoning is required. Only by calibrating our systems in this way—ensuring highly predictable, consistent outcomes in straightforward cases, while empowering true autonomy for intricate, high-value tasks—can we foster both operational trust and innovation to navigate and allow for the above described paradigm shift.

Further resources:

Envision the Future of Generative AI with SAP's AI Agents

AI Agents in Action

In her current role, she is leading SAP BTP Practice in her organisation and is responsible for growing SAP BTP Competencies. She is responsible for making sure that the BTP developments are aligned with the Best Practices recommended by SAP. Also to make sure that BTP teams leverage the finest methodologies and reference architectures. Her role also includes evangelizing about the ‘Art of Possible’ in BTP within the organisation and to clients. Her current areas of focus also include Custom AI/ML solutions, GenAI and Business AI in SAP. Her latest area of interest is BDC and how to leverage BDC to gain business insights. She believes in constant learning and upskilling and encourages her teams to stay updated with latest skills and tools.

She is an active member of SAP Community and an avid blogger. She has participated as a speaker in multiple SAP Inside Track Events in India, Podcasts and Virtual Roundtables during the last 2 years. She is an SAP BTP evangelist and loves to share her knowledge about BTP and AI/ML.

Topics of interest: BTP, AI/ML, GenAI, BDC

Juhi, what inspired you to become an SAP Mentor?

After working for over 20 years in SAP areas, I have encountered numerous challenges and questions raised by clients, analysts, and developers who implement SAP solutions. My teams and I have often provided innovative solutions to these issues. However, without a broader platform to share this knowledge, much of this valuable experience has remained within our organizations.

I am also inspired by the other SAP Mentors and the significant value they contribute to the SAP ecosystem.

As an SAP Mentor, I would like to share knowledge and learn from others’ experiences in this ecosystem. It is a fantastic platform for the cross-pollination of ideas and innovative outcomes. I would be delighted if I could improve the life of even a single developer or client through this process and give back to the wonderful SAP community.

What advice would like to share with other SAP community members?

My advice to other SAP Community members is to always be curious about learning new technologies in SAP. Ask yourself: Why am I implementing a particular SAP technology? Am I able to bring value to the table and provide a great experience for my stakeholders? What kind of impact is my code making ?  You will find that these questions are the triggers where your real learning journey will start. And that’s how I started mine.
